intro: Salsola sieberi var. zygophylla, commonly known as the sandmat or desert sandmat, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of Central Asia and the Middle East. It is a low-growing shrub or perennial herb with fleshy, succulent leaves that help it conserve water in dry environments. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers that bloom in clusters, typically during the summer months. Its root system is extensive, allowing it to anchor firmly in sandy or rocky soils. Salsola sieberi var. zygophylla is adapted to harsh conditions and plays a role in stabilizing desert soils and preventing erosion.
